summary.p: 124 fol.; Writing surface: parchment; Shelfmark: E. H. 18; Text: Q 17-Q 18; 5 lines per page; Dimensions: 180 x 122 mm; Script style: kūfī; Estimated date of production: 3rd (9th) century [according to Karatay].

This entry is based on the catalogue of Fehmi E. Karatay (1888-1968). Currently we do not have access to the images. With exceptions, the catalogue does not contain precise information on the distribution of the text throughout the pages. For this reason, only fol. 1 is given.

Karatay (1962) describes the manuscripts as follows, p. 17: "48 E. H. 18 Kur’an’dan bir bölüm Parşömen. 122mm boy ve 180mm eninde cönk biçiminde 124 yaprak. Sahifede III. (IX) asır kûfî yazısı ile 130mm uzunl.[uğunda] 5 satır. Y. 1a ve 123b ve 124a da Arap üslûbunda müzehhep 3 levha vardır. Miklepli koyu mor deri Osmanlı cildi. Bu mushafta İsrā (17) suresinden Kahf (18) suresinin 74. ayetinin sonuna kadardır."

This can be translated as follows: "48 E. H. 18 A part of the Qurʾān Parchment. 124 junk shaped leaves of 122 mm height and 180 mm width. The text area written in Kufic script of 3rd (9th) century [contains] 5 lines measuring 130 mm. There are three illuminated plates in L. 1a, 123b and 124a in Arabic style. Dark purple Ottoman leather binding with flap (miklep). The codex begins with Q 17 (Sūra al-ʾIsrāʾ) and ends with Q 18 (Sūra al-Kahf)."
